Typealiases.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing8.name: EvalFunc
Typealiases.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing8.abstract: A function which is used to compute the parameters of the involved symbols during the parsing progress of an invocation of a rule.

Typealiases.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing6.name: Tokens
Typealiases.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing6.abstract: Represents the result of parsing a set of terminals at the same position. Each terminal and associated input parameter under consideration is mapped to its set of successfully parsed tokens.

Typealiases.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing9.name: RuleIndex
Typealiases.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing9.abstract: The index of a rule in the Grammar.rules array.

Structs/TerminalKey.html#/s:17EarleyLoca.name: terminalIndex
Structs/TerminalKey.html#/s:17EarleyLoca.abstract: Designates the terminal under consideration, which is Symbol.terminal(index: terminalIndex).

Structs/TerminalKey.html#/s:17EarleyLoca.name: inputParam
Structs/TerminalKey.html#/s:17EarleyLoca.abstract: The input parameter associated with the terminal under consideration.

Structs/Token.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.name: length
Structs/Token.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.abstract: The number of characters in the input that this token encompasses.

Structs/Token.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.name: outputParam
Structs/Token.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.abstract: The output parameter associated with the parsed terminal.

Structs/Token.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.name: result
Structs/Token.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.abstract: An optional result computed for this terminal.

Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.name: lhs
Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.abstract: The left-hand side L of a rule of the form L => R1 ... Rn.

Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.name: rhs
Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.abstract: The right-hand side [R1 ... Rn] of a rule of the form L => R1 ... Rn

Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.name: initialEnv
Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.abstract: The initial environment (actually a copy of it) is passed to eval at stage 0.

Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.name: eval
Structs/Rule.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexing.abstract: The evaluation function responsible for this rule.

Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: symbol
Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The symbol which has been parsed successfully.

Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: inputParam
Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The input parameter of the parsed symbol.

Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: outputParam
Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The output parameter of the parsed symbol.

Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: startPosition
Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The (inclusive) start position of the input range that has been parsed successfully.

Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: endPosition
Structs/ItemKey.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The (exclusive) end position of the input range that has been parsed successfully.

Structs/ItemKey.html.name: ItemKey
Structs/ItemKey.html.abstract: An ItemKey designates a part of the input that has been successfully parsed as a certain symbol with certain parameters.

Structs/Token.html.name: Token
Structs/Token.html.abstract: The result of parsing a terminal (either via a lexer or via rules).

Structs/TerminalKey.html.name: TerminalKey
Structs/TerminalKey.html.abstract: A TerminalKey is used to distinguish which terminal and input parameter are under consideration.

Protocols/Selector.html#/s:17EarleyLocal.name: select(from:alreadySelected:)
Protocols/Selector.html#/s:17EarleyLocal.abstract: Selects a subset of tokens from those tokens which have been successfully parsed at a particular position.

Protocols/Lexer.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: Char
Protocols/Lexer.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The type of character inputs processed by the lexer have.

Protocols/Lexer.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: parse(input:position:key:)
Protocols/Lexer.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: Given a position in input, and a given terminal with given associated input parameter, the lexer returns a set of parsed tokens.

Protocols/GrammarComponent.html#/s:17Ear.name: Param
Protocols/GrammarComponent.html#/s:17Ear.abstract: Each symbol has an input and an output parameter of this type associated with them.

Protocols/GrammarComponent.html#/s:17Ear.name: Result
Protocols/GrammarComponent.html#/s:17Ear.abstract: For a successful parse, optionally a result of this type is computed, as specified per ConstructResult.

Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.name: Char
Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.abstract: The type of characters of the input being parsed.

Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.name: evalRule(input:key:completed:)
Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.abstract: Constructs the result of a successful invocation of a parse rule.

Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.name: terminal(key:result:)
Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.abstract: Constructs the result from a terminal result.

Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.name: merge(key:results:)
Protocols/ConstructResult.html#/s:17Earl.abstract: This is called to merge all results for that particular key into a single result.

Protocols/CompletedRightHandSide.html#/s.name: count
Protocols/CompletedRightHandSide.html#/s.abstract: The number of symbols on the right-hand side of the rule.

Protocols/CompletedRightHandSide.html#/s.name: rhs(_:)
Protocols/CompletedRightHandSide.html#/s.abstract: Returns information about the parse of the k-th symbol on the right-hand side of the rule.

Protocols/CompletedRightHandSide.html.name: CompletedRightHandSide
Protocols/CompletedRightHandSide.html.abstract: Information about the right-hand side of a rule that has successfully completed parsing. This information is used when constructing the result of a successful parse.

Protocols/ConstructResult.html.name: ConstructResult
Protocols/ConstructResult.html.abstract: A ConstructResult is a specification for how to compute the result of a successful parse.

Protocols/EvalEnv.html.name: EvalEnv
Protocols/EvalEnv.html.abstract: An environment which an EvalFunc can use to store information needed during evaluation.

Protocols/GrammarComponent.html.name: GrammarComponent
Protocols/GrammarComponent.html.abstract: Hosts the associated types Param amd Result which are needed throughout the grammar specification.

Protocols/Lexer.html.name: Lexer
Protocols/Lexer.html.abstract: A Lexer manages the custom parsing of terminals.

Protocols/Selector.html.name: Selector
Protocols/Selector.html.abstract: A Selector selects a subset of tokens from those tokens which have been successfully parsed at at particular position.

Enums/ParseResult.html#/s:17EarleyLocalL.name: failed(position:)
Enums/ParseResult.html#/s:17EarleyLocalL.abstract: This denotes the case that parsing has failed at the given position in the input.

Enums/ParseResult.html#/s:17EarleyLocalL.name: success(length:results:)
Enums/ParseResult.html#/s:17EarleyLocalL.abstract: This denotes the case of a successful parse.

Enums/Symbol.html.name: Symbol
Enums/Symbol.html.abstract: A Symbol denotes either a terminal or a nonterminal.

Enums/ParseResult.html.name: ParseResult
Enums/ParseResult.html.abstract: The result of parsing a particular symbol with a particular input parameter.

Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: Param
Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: Each nonterminal and terminal has an input and an output parameter of this type associated with them.

Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: Result
Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: For a successful parse, optionally a result of this type is computed, as specified per ConstructResult.

Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: Char
Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The type of characters that inputs must have which can be parsed by this grammar.

Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: constructResult
Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The specification on how to compute a result from a successful parse.

Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: rulesOf(lhs:)
Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: The rules of this grammar that have lhs as its left-hand side.

Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: init(rules:lexer:selector:constructResult:)
Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: Creates a grammar with the given rules, lexer, selector and result construction specification.

Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.name: parse(input:position:symbol:param:)
Classes/Grammar.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLex.abstract: Parses the given symbol associated with input parameter inputParam from a specified position in input.

Classes/Input.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/Input.html#/s:17EarleyLocalLexin.abstract: Accesses the character at the given position.

Classes/Input.html.name: Input
Classes/Input.html.abstract: Abstracts the input source which is being parsed, and presents itself as a random access vector of characters of type Char.

Classes/Grammar.html.name: Grammar
Classes/Grammar.html.abstract: A Grammar describes the syntax of the language to be parsed. Parsing is based on the concept of parameterized local lexing.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
